vWashington House Rabbit Newsv

Volume 6 Issue 4 December 1997

 

A Well-Bonded
GUS

Dear House Bunnies,

Stanley and I had such a busy and fun summer. The bestest of all was the July bunny picnic. We wiggled our noses so much that they wouldn't wiggle again for two whole days!! We hope next year more of our fuzzy friends will be there, especially girl buns. The biggest thrill for me was hearing several people tell me I looked thinner—I even heard the word "svelte" used to describe me! I know my diet and exercise makes me feel better, but I guess I look better too. I was thinking of asking Santa Bunny for a tummy tuck, but Stanley and I decided that was vain and would make me just another pretty face with whiskers. Stanley came up with a great idea. He reminded me of an article in the last newsletter about a rabbit sanctuary and together we decided to ask Santa Bunny to make a donation in our name. That's a lot better than a tummy tuck!

Nancy recently returned from a trip to New England to visit her family. She didn't tell us much about what they did, but we assume they groomed each other, shared treats, and nuzzled noses. She let us stay at the Best Little Rabbit House Boarding Camp. Someday she wants to take us up in the sky with her. She told us she needed details on how to fly with bunnies. Stan and I have no idea what any of this means. If anybunny read this and has been in what sounds to us like a gigantic flying hutch, please write us all about it.

Last weekend, Uncle Leo, Stanley, and I were watching a football game. Stan and I don't really get it. Are the humans all blind? Is that why they run into each other? Are those little balls so expensive they can't each have their own? It seems to us we should collect money and buy each player his own ball so they don't have to spend several hours fighting over one. Also, why can't they decide where they want the ball? We wanted to ask Uncle Leo, but didn't want to ruin the atmosphere of male bonding. Don't tell Nancy, but Uncle Leo gave each of us half a Dorito chip! We like male bonding!! Stanley wants to go to a Promise Keepers' Convention. He thinks there must be lots of Doritos there.

Well, by for now. In my next letter I'll be writing about our trip to Whistler. We are all going there in November. Stan and I know it'll be cold so we're busy growing fur.

Carrot crunches and hay munches,

Gus (& Stanley)

Editor's note: HRS thanks Gus and Stanley for their very generous donation to the Sanctuary fund Thank you Gus & Stanley!!.
